I have the honor to submit a communication from the Academy of sciences of Chicago
MS accompanied by a 4-page circular 'To the Friends and Correspondents of the Chicago Academy of Sciences', dated Chicago, 30 October 1871, and signed by the Academy's President, J. W. Foster, and Secretary, Wm. Stimpson. The circular reported that the Academy's building, 'with all its movable property, records and effects, and the scientific materials which had been accumulated since its origin', had been totally destroyed in the great Chicago fire of 9 October of that year, and gave details of the scientific and other materials that had been lost.
The file also includes a requisition dated 24 March 1872, submitted by M for one copy of each of 'Fragm. phytr. Austr.', 'Chath Isl Veget.' [B64.10.02], 'Austral Mosses [B64.10.03] and 'Plants of Victoria' [B62.03.03, B65.02.06], to be supplied by the Government Printer for the Chicago Academy.
The file was initialled by Duffy as 'Appd'. from which it will be seen that the Academy is anxious to restore the library and other collections, destroyed by the great conflagration. I venture therefore to submit on my part, whether the series of my works, presented formerly to the Academy by the Victorian Government may not be restored.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obed. servant
